subject: Education
title: The Forgetting Curve: Why You Forget 80% Within a Day
description: A fast breakdown of The Forgetting Curve: Why You Forget 80% Within a Day for builders.

hook.text: Hermann Ebbinghaus proved in 1885 that we forget 80% of what we learn within 24 hours. The curve drops like a cliff.

buildup.text: Ebbinghaus memorized lists of nonsense syllables and tested himself at intervals. The results were devastating.

discovery.text: But each review flattens the curve. After 4-5 spaced reviews, the memory becomes nearly permanent.

twist.text: Most schools test once, at the end. This is the opposite of what the forgetting curve demands. We test too late.

climax.text: The forgetting curve is the most important discovery in education psychology â€” and the most widely ignored.
